value:
I had hoped to never again
have reason to fight...

I was compensated for more than I
deserved after the War of Shadows...$k$pI left the military not long after and
donated that money to an orphanage.

I owe a great debt to Lord Hardin.
The artistocrats of Aurelis subjugated
my people until he freed us.

I'm a little surprised by how relaxed
everyone in Askr is, even in the midst
of fierce battles.$k$pThat must speak to just how prepared
everyone truly is...and how ready you
must be to survive such conflicts.

I'm writing a letter, but...is there a
way to send it to the realm I was
summoned from?

I am Roshea, of the knights of Aurelis.
Is $Nu here?
This is from $Nf!
I'll try to do even better next time!

I don't wish to fight, but...
If it's for my brothers, I will!
That...wasn't very good, was it?
All right, let's do this!

I am Roshea, of the knights of Aurelis.
I've mostly avoided actual battles,
but I think we will work well together.

I understand well how Wolf feels, for
I was the same. We were determined
to fight for Aurelis, for our future...$k$pBut, no matter our intentions, sadness
was born as a result of our actions.
It's an unavoidable truth of war.$k$pEvery soldier you see on a battlefield
has someone—be it parent, sibling, or
even child—praying for their safety.$k$pThe king of Aurelis was frail, so he
vested all of his power and faith in
his younger brother, Hardin.$k$pIt was no doubt the wisest decision,
but the king still showed great
courage by doing it so swiftly.$k$pAfter all, everyone has the potential
to become a tyrant after gaining
power—as Archanea can attest to.$k$pBut the courage to let go of that
power... That is a rare and truly
amazing thing.$k$pI do not wish for the Coyote's Men
to follow the mistaken path Coyote
went down.$k$pHeh, and you might call me naive for
it, but I also wish he had not lost his
way in the first place.
でやっ
そこだ！
ううっ
I can't lose...
Do not interfere!
I don't want violence!
Please forgive me.
I must stay true.
Coyote...
Hehe
I'm Roshea of the knights of Aurelis. You have my support.
Wh— Hey! Is that how you...express kindness here?
In Aurelis, my comrades and I are known as the Coyote's Men.
I could never have believed Lord Marth's goal was conquest.
Vyland might be swayed as well, if my words reach him.
Are we in the right?
I believe your heart is just. My strength is yours to wield.
As you say.
That way, huh?
Just so.
